website_summaries.verdict: A high-quality chainsaw for budget price that will cut down small trees, logs, and bushes.
pros: It features an 8-amp electric motor running a 14-inch low kickback bar that will handle most small trees and logs
At less than eight pounds, it won’t break your back during a long day’s work either
cons: The  four-ounce oil tank that lubricates the chain has issues with leaking

customer_reviews.title: Don't expect a monster saw, but a serviceable one.
customer_reviews.text: I've had it a few weeks and can't complain one bit. I wanted to cut down a bunch of leaning and dead trees from around my property, and this little guy did the trick. Is it a big, monster gas powered? No, of course not, it's a $50 electric chainsaw, but if you only need it to clean up a bit, and use it within it's means, it's a little work horse. Very happy to have it.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product. Invest in a gas powered one. I followed the instructions to a T. I was able to make 4 cuts on a 6” diameter dried out cottonwood before it got gummed up and the chain adjustment (which you have to adjust after every cut) stopped working. I had to disassemble it, clean it thoroughly, and put it back together, only to repeat the same painful experience. I wish I hadn’t delayed using it so that I would’ve been able to return it. I seriously have no idea why this product is still being sold. It’s utterly useless.
customer_reviews.author: Jax418

customer_reviews.title: WOW! Amazing little chainsaw!
customer_reviews.text: This little guy absolutely came through and amazed me. Plenty of power and super easy to setup and use! Recommend to anyone for smaller trees and brush.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Chain gets loose
customer_reviews.text: The chain gets loose a lot and there's no easy way to tighten it up. For the money, I guess a couple of uses out of it is fine and it definitely is a time saver. I used it once around the yard to cut some small trees and brush. It's pretty much used up at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Amazons Customers

customer_reviews.title: This is a great size for if you have smaller trees or bushes ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great size for if you have smaller trees or bushes to trim up. Easy to handle. Did have to do some assemble once it arrived
customer_reviews.author: L.J. Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Chain falls off despite tension
customer_reviews.text: As others have said, the chain falls right off after about 15 minutes of first use, then every 3 minutes after that. Too bad too besides a lot of assembly, it seemed like a decent little limb saw.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and works like a champ who needs a guy to cut down that tree!
customer_reviews.text: A chainsaw a 65 year old woman can use. My husband had a gas saw but that scared me and who was going to start it for me {he passed away} ? This saw enabled me to cut down some tall trees with ease. I did know how to notch them after watching hubby do it for years. The squirrel's were getting in the garage leaping on the roof getting in at soffit. No more trees hopefully problem solved!
customer_reviews.author: patricia clark

customer_reviews.title: It’s a good electric chain saw
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good electric chainsaw, plenty powerful and not nearly as noisy as gas saws. Yes it will leak oil when stored, almost all electric chainsaws do this by design so the bar and chain are properly lubricated when using- you’re supposed to empty the oil when storing.
customer_reviews.author: CL

customer_reviews.title: Cuts quick and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: It is light and best of all, I don't have to fuss with mixing fuel and trying to get the darn thing started. Plug it in and push the switch. The chain cuts quickly and I imagine it will be good even up a 9" or 12" branch. I am sure this is not a use it all day long tool (but haven't tried it), but it will make quick work of trim branches and reducing cuttings to a more manageable pile. Just wish I had bought the pole mounted saw. I thought I could just purchase the add on accessory to mount it on a pole, but I was wrong. Not the mfr fault, mine.
customer_reviews.author: Neutron Boy

customer_reviews.title: Love this saw!
customer_reviews.text: As a 50 yr old female; I love this saw! It's durable enough to do all the work you want it to! I hate how heavy & hard to maneuver gas powered saws can be. Then add in the drama of premixing. Forget all that. Plug it in & do the work you want done all by yourself!
customer_reviews.author: Jenn from Newington CT

customer_reviews.title: Good saw with a slight flaw
customer_reviews.text: It's a decent saw. People were right though, it does leak chain lube after it's been sitting. Directions tell you to empty the reservoir between uses. I've read this is a common problem with electric saws. I didn't see it as a big deal as you it's not a high capacity tank and the tool is really light. Overall I think it was worth the money, however, I don't use it a ton.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: I love this chain saw.....
customer_reviews.text: I just used my chain saw last week on some old redwood planks. It easily cut right through. I am a 64 year old woman and found that it was easy and lightweight to use. It is the first time I have used a chain saw in my life and had a little trepidation but as soon as I used it I was a confident sawer of wood and logs.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Defective Product
customer_reviews.text: Does NOT work at all wouldn’t even cut one tree limb let alone logs anywhere near the dimensions show in the advertisement and (FAKE) reviews. One Star reviews are 100% accurate. I am returning this product. Among other things is UNSAFE! The chain comes off way too easy because the tensioner doesn’t stay taught and instead rattles loose before you can even start to make a cut and the chain is so dull.
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: Works Much Better than I could have expected!
customer_reviews.text: When I purchased this electric chainsaw I didn't have any high expectations for it. I also, didn't think it would be able to cut anywhere near as well as my gas chainsaw, but I was wrong. First off this chainsaw is lightweight and that alone makes it some much nicer than my heavy gas chainsaw! Second, it cuts just as good if not better than my chain saw! It works best when you're cutting anything 10 inches in diameter or less. Good Buy !
customer_reviews.author: chad

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS SAW
customer_reviews.text: I read mixed reviews on this and chose to buy it anyway. I LOVE IT. It cuts through anything and everything. AND the chain adjustment requires no tools. I used to hate having to use a wrench on my old chain saw. This is brilliantly designed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great chainsaw and great value.  Excellent!!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing kicks ass. Glad I purchased this. It does a fantastic job. Cuts through stuff like butter. Keep it clean! It does leak a bit, but don't fill it up all the way. Just put in a little oil for the job then either drain it or get rid of the excess. I highly recommend this it does work great. You will be looking for stuff to cut trust me.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Pulverente

customer_reviews.title: Do not add oil unless you are using it right away!!
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing in the instructions stating that when you add the oil, it will run out all over the carpet if you are not using the machine. What kind of crap is that? I am going to submit a claim for carpet replacement also!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Lynne Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Leaks oil
customer_reviews.text: I haven't even used it yet, so I can't attest to that. I assembled it, put oil in it and left it setting horizontal, as they say you are suppose to, and came back to it a couple days later to find a puddle of oil and the indicator shows that it is down to "min" line. Not happy with that.
customer_reviews.author: Nik

customer_reviews.title: Don't listen to some of negative posts.
customer_reviews.text: Once you tighten the chain correctly, it DON'T come off! Also, ALL chainsaws are designed to leak oil on the chain! You should store chainsaw hanging from the HOLE in blade. This will prevent the oil from draining out!
customer_reviews.author: inside scoop

customer_reviews.title: Great for home use where you have access to power.
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to assemble and had use. The chain stayed exactly where it should be and it didn’t leak any oil like some of the other reviews claimed. I cut down two large evergreens and cut the limbs and trunk into small manageable sizes and the saw worked perfectly and is still sharp. Nice and quiet so the neighbors weren’t bothered also!
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and surprisingly powerful
customer_reviews.text: We use this saw around the house for cutting limbs and removing dead trees up to 8” in diameter. We also like that it will run off our 2000watt Yamaha camping generator when we are out of extension cord range. We’ve used it quite a bit and no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Larson

customer_reviews.title: get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I'm getting a little older now and I've owned 3 or 4 chain saws. I bought this for around the property here. Something light for small jobs. I started it and the chain immediately loosened. Fixed it and starting cutting. Over and over, I had to take it apart and reset the chain. Very poor design. I have a Worx leaf vac and blower works great. This? Not so much.
customer_reviews.author: Maynard S Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Handy for home use.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this saw to cut several trees down. The saw is quite powerful for home use. Just make sure that the chain is taught and oiled. To tighten, simply point the blade down, loosen the cover, and retighten it. Also make sure that sawdust doesn't block the oil paths.
customer_reviews.author: CGDavila

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price...
customer_reviews.text: The chain came of a few time cutting the bigger tree..but for the price, it will get the job done for normal use. Not for heavy duty work though...Great for normal backyard use....
customer_reviews.author: Murtaza

customer_reviews.title: Would Buy Again
customer_reviews.text: Works very good. Had no problem cutting and clearing trees away from my property.
customer_reviews.author: Gold

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use and light weight
customer_reviews.text: I have several trees in my back yard. They are about 15 inch diameter and don't want to hire tree company to cut them down. I looked at it and I thought I could do it by myself. It just needs to attach the chain to the body and pour some oil and ready to use. It only took 20 minutes to cut and chop pieces a midium size tree.
customer_reviews.author: Ncmom

customer_reviews.title: Serious power
customer_reviews.text: I took down and chopped up a dozen cypress trees with this. average height 20 Feet. figured id throw it away for the price after if it died but it made the tool shed. highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Super buy
customer_reviews.text: Powerful little saw . Awesome deal great for the money. Fast shipping quality is awesome
customer_reviews.author: Brad W.

customer_reviews.title: Get the buzz going!
customer_reviews.text: This saw exceeded my expectations for a reasonabily priced chain saw. Easy to assemble and very powerful.
customer_reviews.author: R. Weston

customer_reviews.title: Electric Chain Saw
customer_reviews.text: Used saw about 2 hours to cut small trees and under brush. It did what I needed done. Chain kept jumping off and It was a little aggravating. Do not like the chain tightening process.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Braun

customer_reviews.title: I needed something cheap that can get the job done.
customer_reviews.text: I recently cut down some arms of a tree. I started doing it by hand cuz my wife is cheap and almost had a heart attack. I said forget this i’m buying something electric than can get the job done. Easy to assemble just gotta pay attention to the chain and the way it sits. It was easy to use and quick to cut the tree into smaller pieces so i can stuff them in a lawn bag. Great buy
customer_reviews.author: Tammy W.

customer_reviews.title: Not the best, but for the price not bad.
customer_reviews.text: After 3 logs cut, chain is very loose and needs to be tightened. I'm a bit disappointed in that. Otherwise, seems to be ok... I'll update review after cutting about 50 logs. (all about 6 inches wide)
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap, plastic gear, yes I opened it. Chain keeps dislodging after 2 cuts. Have to stop, reseat chain to try again. It doesn’t matter thickness of tree sapling to 4 inch still pops off. If you buy this keep box because you’ll be ready to return it. Unfortunately I tossed box because my Worx 18” had been a great workhorse. Going back to 18” after I get power button fixed or maybe buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Anna L. Wingate

customer_reviews.title: Smell no gas
customer_reviews.text: For what I need bigger tree limbs fall storm damage cut up pretty good size limds No oil and gas to deal with !
customer_reviews.author: Brian G.

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight corded chain saw.
customer_reviews.text: Used old utility poles as posts to support my deck. Gas chain saw continued to be intermittent so I bought the WORX. 8A motor still runs fine behind 200’ of extension cords.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This saw is easy to use. The chain does come off from time to time but easy enough to put back on. I mainly use this to trim branches and removing bushes around my home.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Johnson

customer_reviews.title: SHARP , CUTS FAST
customer_reviews.text: IT CHOPPED UP A HUGE BOUGAINVILLEA TREE/BUSH IN AN HOUR! GREAT VALUE FOR THE MONEY , LADY PAID ME 50 FOR THE SAW WHEN I WAS DONE PLUS 60- THKS
customer_reviews.author: Greg H.

customer_reviews.title: Little leakey but who cares?
customer_reviews.text: So it leaks a little, big whop. I took down a effin' deck with this little sucker. Easy to assemble and does what a chainsaw should, chop shiz up.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia E Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Unexpected
customer_reviews.text: The power was unexpected. Perfect for once in a while cuts. Did fune on a 10 inch thick limb no problem. Very light and manageable
customer_reviews.author: Leonard Q.

customer_reviews.title: Little work horse.
customer_reviews.text: This saw is a work horse dont let its size fool you. Now obviously it's not as powerful as a gas powered but if you allow it to do the work without forcing it, itll work just fine. The chain did go slack on me just once, and only once. Some of the reviews say it leaks oil.....just empty remaining oil back into the container problem solved. All in all for a days use around the house a perfect tool.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: The perfect tool to cut up to 5 or 6 inch trees. I'm 64 and can handle saw perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Chain hard to put back on and oil leaks
customer_reviews.text: It was difficult to assemble. Instructions and graphics were too small and hard to read Chain and tension were hard to adjust. Chain kept falling off and not easy to put back on unless you have somebody to help you and the worst part is the oil leaks once you put it up. Ended up all over the floor of my storage unit
customer_reviews.author: Chefette

customer_reviews.title: don't fill more then have way . oil will leak. once it was less then half way it stopped.
customer_reviews.text: This a good little work horse, works very well sounds great. easy to oil.
customer_reviews.author: Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Little storm cutter
customer_reviews.text: Sears sells same product for 3x the price. Cuts branches and small trees like a champ!
customer_reviews.author: Cruiser

customer_reviews.title: Sawzall works better for me.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't cut very well chain saw teeth dull very quickly my sawzall works works better.
customer_reviews.author: LOwens

customer_reviews.title: Oil Leaks
customer_reviews.text: Im not sure why its leaking oil all over my garage floor. I placed it on the table and only used it once to cut some branches. Guess u get what u pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well made and light weight.
customer_reviews.text: Very much worth the cost $. Took down a big tree with ease. Chain slips a lot. But every brand I’ve had does that.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Oliver

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, but having oil leakage
customer_reviews.text: Having an issue with oil leaking. Will use again. But if it continues, inwill return product.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Trimmer
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Worth the money, work horse on the bushes!
customer_reviews.author: laurie raeburn

customer_reviews.title: OIL LEAK!
customer_reviews.text: Would easily give it 4 or 5 stars but leaks oil constantly. So I have to oil it before every use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Girl friendly
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my sister. It's easy for her to use for quick yard trimming and clean up
customer_reviews.author: jeanine

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size
customer_reviews.text: I have small hands and find this model just perfect for me to handle.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra McCollum

customer_reviews.title: Two thumbs up!
customer_reviews.text: Awsome little saw, definitely worth the money! I highly recommend this saw for trimming trees around the yard.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Worx is an amazing product!
customer_reviews.text: Liked everything about this product,does exactly as advertised, Worx is a great company. You get what you pay for!!
customer_reviews.author: Cherie Miller

customer_reviews.title: Worked great right out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: This review comes after just one use but...This lil thing did great on its first call to duty! I was able to take down a 20 tall three feet around eucalyptus tree with no problems!
customer_reviews.author: joshy b.

customer_reviews.title: Great value.
customer_reviews.text: Works great for smaller trees. Largest trunk I cut was about 6”. No issues for my house hold utility use.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Very inexpensive but not heavy duty enough I suppose
customer_reviews.text: The chain does not stay on more than 5 minutes
customer_reviews.author: susan m truitt

customer_reviews.title: Soooo worth the $$
customer_reviews.text: Cut down this whole tree, (one on the right) and all the fallen stuff!! never had an issue, great value, great chainsaw!
customer_reviews.author: Leah Howard

customer_reviews.title: Great chain saw
customer_reviews.text: Took care of the job, cut though a large weed tree. A must buy.
customer_reviews.author: R.B.

customer_reviews.title: Good Deal on a budget
customer_reviews.text: Dor an electric chainsaw, I was really surprised by how powerful it is. It felled a tree with a 16" diameter trunk relatively easy. I have used it for various other projects, for a total of 10 hours worth of usage and it has no given me one problem.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Pearson

customer_reviews.title: leaks chain oil everywhere
customer_reviews.text: I used it once put in the shed and find oil soaked into the wooden self!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Chuck  Steris

customer_reviews.title: Cutting ability.
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves to trim trees and this saw makes it easy. Cuts large or small branches.
customer_reviews.author: John H. Christiansen

customer_reviews.title: Easily cuts logs, Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Other than the oil leak, the chainsaw works really good. I was able to cut railroad ties, retaining wall logs, small trees easily.
customer_reviews.author: SR

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy! Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had it but nothing more than a month I cut down one tree and then it broke literally. It's a piece of crap, I really wish I would have kept my money. I know next time I'm done with the company over this.
customer_reviews.author: Wil mac

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of power
customer_reviews.text: Perfect limbing and brush saw. Beats the heck out of climbing with a gas one!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: Great little saw and considering the price, it can't be beat!
customer_reviews.author: Betty

customer_reviews.title: very easy to handle
customer_reviews.text: I'm 76 and found this saw to be exactly what I needed. Had no trouble trimming trees in my yard. Very light weight.
customer_reviews.author: mary van der meulen

customer_reviews.title: Keep extension cord secure and out of the way.
customer_reviews.text: Very rugged. Cuts through 10 in logs with no problems. Leaks chain oil like every chainsaw I've had after setting a while.
customer_reviews.author: Robin S. Hires

customer_reviews.title: Great for small jobs.
customer_reviews.text: Two issues: the chain jumps off the tract and has to be tightened frequently, and it leaks oil
customer_reviews.author: Donna Keeton

customer_reviews.title: Great little saw for the money
customer_reviews.text: I had to take down a few 2 inch diameter trees and this worked great. So happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Ledermom

customer_reviews.title: Value for money!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for regular yard work like trim trees, bushes etc. It works awesome! Value for money item!
customer_reviews.author: VF

customer_reviews.title: Excellent saw!
customer_reviews.text: Did all the jobs I needed it to do without hesitation.

customer_reviews.title: plastic chain holer
customer_reviews.text: when sawing chain would jump off bar alot no matter what size wood i was cutting, plastic gears worried me also
customer_reviews.author: richawk

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Great I cut down like 5 trees with it also trim other trees with it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I used this for cutting down small trees on my property. It works great
customer_reviews.author: Wanda M Muthard

customer_reviews.title: Wast of money
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy it is a waste of money, The chain won't stay on
customer_reviews.author: Mike Knaup

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Worxing in 20 minutes
customer_reviews.text: On its way back. It cut fine for 20 minutes. Then the chain came off during every cut. the bar and chain are held on, and together, by one tool-less knob. Return window is very short. No stated warranty. Junk product. I missed Amazon's SHORT return window.
customer_reviews.author: Rooster Booster

customer_reviews.title: it works great for what i bought it for.
customer_reviews.text: easy assembly, cut thru 4" limbs like butter. very impressed with how well it worked.
customer_reviews.author: randy h.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Does the job fast, very easy to handle, light weight, excellent tool.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Simone

customer_reviews.title: Yes, it is easy for a women to use!
customer_reviews.text: It was very easy to use i am happy with my chainsaw
customer_reviews.author: karen

customer_reviews.title: Auto-Tension Feature is a Myth
customer_reviews.text: The saw is advertised with auto-tension. If there is a auto-tension feature I have not seen it work. Chatted with Workx and they could not tell how the feature works. They reiterated manual tension is recommended. If, as I, you purchase the saw for auto tension you will be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Bernard C. Wilkerson

customer_reviews.title: Chain comes off constantly!
customer_reviews.text: Chain comes off every 30-60 seconds. Spend 90% of the time fixing it. When it’s on, it works quite nicely.
customer_reviews.author: MnB

customer_reviews.title: Ok for the price
customer_reviews.text: The chain comes off pretty quick, but I don't use it much and it was a good price. The chain is easy to put back on so it doesn't really affect what I do with it.
customer_reviews.author: Clarence

customer_reviews.title: I am a HUGE fan of WORX products.
customer_reviews.text: This chainsaw works as it is advertised. I didn't want to use a gas chainsaw and this was the answer to what I was looking for. I own a lot of WORX tools that are battery operated. I am a HUGE fan of WORX products.
customer_reviews.author: Van the Solar Man

customer_reviews.title: Stick to traditional tension methods for chainsaws.
customer_reviews.text: The chain auto tension function simply did not work on this saw. Chain goes loose the instant I start cutting anything.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan sutton

customer_reviews.title: Not good for doing simple cuttings of limbs.
customer_reviews.text: Not a good product. Supposed to automatically tighten the chain. Does not. Had to manually retighten after every cut. Tried to use for cleanup after hurricane Irma. Hard to maintain in operating condition. Chain was sharp but requires constant maintaince. Put the tool in recycling. Too difficult to pack for returning.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer who is an elderly male.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: have not used yet but have other Worx tools and am sure it will suit my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great saw for an even better price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great saw and was easy to assemble. It cut up a downed 10" diameter tree with ease. I would highly recommend this saw for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Robneck

customer_reviews.title: I will reorder this item because I ordered the wrong one. I really love this company’s products.
customer_reviews.text: Had to return it. I ordered the wrong one. I need a battery operated chain saw.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Frender

product_meta.title: Worx WG305.1, 8 Amp 14-inch Corded Electric Chainsaw with Auto-Tension, Chain Brake
product_meta.description: The WORX chainsaw is a compact powerhouse. It offers a powerful 8 Amp motor in a lightweight and efficient 14-inch design. This low-maintenance chainsaw has a patented auto-tensioning chain system to help extend the life of the bar and chain. In addition, the automatic, tool-free chain tensioning system and oil level indicator makes it even easier to operate and maintain. This 14-inch compact powerhouse, has a comfortable rubberized over grip handle to improve comfort and stability. The WORX chainsaw is easy to use for light to medium duty trimming, lambing, pruning and clean up around the yard.
feature_bullets: Patented auto tension chain system for extended Bar & chain life
Powerful 8 amp motor offers a consistent performance
Chain Lubrication with oil lever indicator
Oil tank capacity 4 flu oz; and chain pitch is 3/8 in

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars368 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
